title: PVP.net Patcher Kernel has stopped working?
body: Hey Riot, so I've been trying to start up LoL for the past week or so and ever time a box pops up and tells me "PVP.net Patcher Kernel has stopped working: A problem cause the program to stop working correctly...." Can you guys (or anyone) tell me what this Patcher Kernel thing is and how I can get it working again? It's been a while since I played League and I've been itching to pick start a few games.

replies.body: If you right click the League of Legends icon and click "Run as administrator" it should work! It'll ask a yes or no question and you just click yes then it starts like normal. Mines been doing the same thing for months.....
oh my god tysm i've been trying to figure out how to fix it for like 2 hours now

Whenever you see this "kernel" error, there's a good chance that your OS is blocking the patcher from running properly. Essentially, your OS needs to have permission to allow the any program to run. Without those permissions, your OS just shoots it down and won't let it launch, which seems to be what's going on here.

Follow our [Permission Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) to get everything in place, then your OS should stop blocking the patcher!
Worked for me too.  I'm pretty sure I saw the UAC prompt without having to run as administrator, but oh well..  windows 10 security being picky I guess.
I found it helpful to go to the "League Of Legends" folder, then right click on the "lol.launcher.admin" and select "run as adminstrator".
